Assignment 1: Personal Details Using Primitive Data Types
Objective: Practice variables and System.out.println.
Question:
Write a Java program that:
•	Stores the following details using primitive data types only:
o	Age (int)
o	Height in centimeters (float)
o	Mobile number (long)
o	Is student (boolean)
•	Prints all the values on separate lines.

package assignment1;

public class Personaldetails {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
          int Age=26;
          System.out.println(Age);
          
          float Height=170.5F;
          System.out.println(Height);
          
          long phonenumber=9148006040l;
          System.out.println(phonenumber);
          
          boolean Isstudentpresent=true;
          System.out.println(Isstudentpresent);
          
	}

}
OUTPUT:
26
170.5
9148006040
true



Assignment 2: Display All Primitive Data Types
Objective: Understand Java primitive data types.
Question:
Write a Java program that declares one variable for each primitive data type:
•	byte
•	short
•	int
•	long
•	float
•	double
•	char
•	boolean

package assignment1;

public class Datatypes {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
        int num=-987654321;
        System.out.println(num);

        long phonenumber=9148006040789l;
        System.out.println(phonenumber);

        boolean result=true;
        System.out.println(result);
        
        byte ans=127;
        System.out.println(ans);
        
        short data=-32000;
        System.out.println(data);
        
        char alpha='M';
        System.out.println(alpha);
        
        float marks=97.2F;
        System.out.println(marks);
        
        double data1=12.1234567890123;
        System.out.println(data1);
	
	}

}
OUTPUT:
-987654321
9148006040789
true
127
-32000
M
97.2
12.1234567890123


Assignment 3: Marks of Three Subjects
Objective: Practice using integer variables.
Question:
Write a Java program that:
•	Stores marks of three subjects in int variables
•	Stores pass/fail status in a boolean variable
•	Prints all values on separate lines

package assignment1;

public class Marks {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
        int Subject1marks=75;
        System.out.println(Subject1marks);
        int Subject2marks=68;
        System.out.println(Subject2marks);
        int Subject3marks=82;
        System.out.println(Subject3marks);
        boolean Result=true;
        System.out.println(Result);
	}

}
OUTPUT:
75
68
82
true
